trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of gender in the cardiovascular autonomic responses and cardiorespiratory capacity before and after an aerobic physical training
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Autonomics and cardiorespiratories improvements in middle age men and women in response to aerobic physical training

conditions.healthcondition: middle age men and women clinically healthy, sedentary (at least 6 months without any physical training)
prevention of chronic cardiovascular diseases such as hypertension

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal development and function of the cardiovascular system

interventions.interventions: Aerobic Physical Training, during 12 weeks, 3 times a week, 60 minutes each session , intensity between 70 and 85 of the maximal heart rate.
interventions.comparator: the study uses as comparator the initial condition of the volunteers: sedentary (pre training) condition

primaryOutcome.outcome: Improvements of autonomic and cardiorespiratory systems by aerobic physical training.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The volunteers were evaluated pre training and after 12 weeks of training

primaryOutcome.outcome: rest heart rate and arterial blood pressure by non invasive methods (eletrocardiography and esphygmomanometry)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: before start the training protocol and after 12 weeks of training

secondaryOutcome.outcome: comparison between genders (arterial blood pressure, the values of autonomic indicators, cardiorespiratry capacity)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: The volunteers were evaluated pre training and after 12 weeks of training

secondaryOutcome.outcome: 'Aerobic capacity was measured by a cycle ergometer protocol with gas analysys during the effort, until exaustion'
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: before start the training protocol and after 12 weeks of training

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: clinically healthy (by cardiological exams), at least 6 months without any physical training practice, the women must take hormonal therapy replacement.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: volunteers that were practicing regular physical and / or who had the clinical evaluation and / or laboratory tests or any other condition that would complicadores risk factors to the practice of regular physical activity proposal, such as: coronary artery disease, hypertension, diabetes, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, or who were using any medications that interfere in physiological responses to the tests.

trial_design.designfeatures: we do not study a control group
